        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.         The heap-buffer-overflow trace is v8::internal::HandleScope::ZapRange() zapping past its range:<span class="line"><!---->The heap-buffer-overflow trace is v8::internal::HandleScope::ZapRange() zapping past its range:<!----></span><br>  0x62500000e8f0 is located 0 bytes after 8176-byte region<span class="line"><!---->  0x62500000e8f0 is located 0 bytes after 8176-byte region<!----></span><br>which was previously set in v8::internal::HandleScope::Extend<span class="line"><!---->which was previously set in v8::internal::HandleScope::Extend<!----></span><br><br>Trying to repro on linux asan, but not getting any crash. I am trying without --use-fake-ui-for-media-stream, which is only meant to be used in tests.<span class="line"><!---->Trying to repro on linux asan, but not getting any crash.         I also cannot reproduce this crash on Linux and I don't have an M1/M2 Mac to try. <span class="line"><!---->I also cannot reproduce this crash on Linux and I don't have an M1/M2 Mac to try. <!----></span><br><br>For transparency, I'm using this launcher script with the POC address passed from the command line, and hosted from a secure context:<span class="line"><!---->For transparency, I'm using this launcher script with the POC address passed from the command line, and hosted from a secure context:<!----></span><br><br>#!/bin/bash<span class="line"><!---->#!/bin/bash<!----></span><br>$CHROME_ASAN --incognito --user-data-dir=/tmp/x1 --disable-gpu --no-sandbox --no-zygote $1 &<span class="line"><!---->$CHROME_ASAN --incognito --user-data-dir=/tmp/x1 --disable-gpu --no-sandbox --no-zygote $1 &amp;<!----></span><br>$CHROME_ASAN --incognito --user-data-dir=/tmp/x2 --disable-gpu --no-sandbox --no-zygote $1 &<span class="line"><!---->$CHROME_ASAN --incognito --user-data-dir=/tmp/x2 --disable-gpu --no-sandbox --no-zygote $1 &amp;<!----></span><br>$CHROME_ASAN --incognito --user-data-dir=/tmp/x3 --disable-gpu --no-sandbox --no-zygote $1 && fg<span class="line"><!---->$CHROME_ASAN --incognito --user-data-dir=/tmp/x3 --disable-gpu --no-sandbox --no-zygote $1 &amp;&amp; fg<!----></span><br><br>I'm asking around to see if a colleague with an AArch64 Mac can attempt to reproduce, but for now this is inactionable until we have a reliable POC.<span class="line"><!---->I'm asking around to see if a colleague with an AArch64 Mac can attempt to reproduce, but for now this is inactionable until we have a reliable POC.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Blink&gt;Network&gt;StreamsAPI
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Thank you @nharper! Both <span class="line"><!---->Thank you @nharper! Both <!----></span>#c10<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c10"><!---->#c10<!----></a> and <span class="line"><!----> and <!----></span>#c11<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c11"><!---->#c11<!----></a> are enough of an indication of bugs to warrant asking code owners to take a closer look.<span class="line"><!----> are enough of an indication of bugs to warrant asking code owners to take a closer look.<!----></span><br><br>Setting security flags:<span class="line"><!---->Setting security flags:<!----></span><br>- High severity due to memory corruption that can plausibly lead to remote code execution in the renderer sandbox. <span class="line"><!---->- High severity due to memory corruption that can plausibly lead to remote code execution in the renderer sandbox. <!----></span><br>- Only Mac and Linux for now - even though we haven't been able to repro on Linux - but nothing about the call stack obviously suggests platform specific code. <span class="line"><!---->- Only Mac and Linux for now - even though we haven't been able to repro on Linux - but nothing about the call stack obviously suggests platform specific code. <!----></span><br>- Because of the difficulty we had reproducing this bug, FoundIn-110 is based only on the reporter's assessment. <span class="line"><!---->- Because of the difficulty we had reproducing this bug, FoundIn-110 is based only on the reporter's assessment. <!----></span><br><br>@owners - Thanks for your help!         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The heap-buffer-overflow trace is v8::internal::HandleScope::ZapRange() zapping past its range:<span class="line"><!---->The heap-buffer-overflow trace is v8::internal::HandleScope::ZapRange() zapping past its range:<!----></span><br>  0x62500000e8f0 is located 0 bytes after 8176-byte region<span class="line"><!---->  0x62500000e8f0 is located 0 bytes after 8176-byte region<!----></span><br>which was previously set in v8::internal::HandleScope::Extend<span class="line"><!---->which was previously set in v8::internal::HandleScope::Extend<!----></span><br><br>Trying to repro on linux asan, but not getting any crash. I am trying without --use-fake-ui-for-media-stream, which is only meant to be used in tests.<span class="line"><!---->Trying to repro on linux asan, but not getting any crash. I am trying without --use-fake-ui-for-media-stream, which is only meant to be used in tests.<!----></span><br><br>If the crashes require that flag, then it represents bugs that can affect tests and cause flakiness but doesn't represent a security bug.<span class="line"><!---->If the crashes require that flag, then it represents bugs that can affect tests and cause flakiness but doesn't represent a security bug.<!----></span><br><br>Reporter: do you have any repro that doesn't require that flag?<span class="line"><!---->Reporter: do you have any repro that doesn't require that flag?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This is a new poc that can be reproduced without the --use-fake-ui-for-media-stream flag. When running, a 'use microphone' prompt will appear, click "allow".<span class="line"><!---->This is a new poc that can be reproduced without the --use-fake-ui-for-media-stream flag.         All ReadableStreamDefaultControllerWithScriptScope::Enqueue() is doing is entering a ScriptState::Scope and calling ToV8(). So although it appears in the stack trace I don't think it is the cause of the issue.<span class="line"><!---->All ReadableStreamDefaultControllerWithScriptScope::Enqueue() is doing is entering a ScriptState::Scope and calling ToV8(). So although it appears in the stack trace I don't think it is the cause of the issue.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.       Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>os version:<span class="line"><!---->os version:<!----></span><br>macos 12.6<span class="line"><!---->macos 12.6<!----></span><br>ubuntu 22.04<span class="line"><!---->ubuntu 22.04<!----></span><br>chrome version:<span class="line"><!---->chrome version:<!----></span><br>110.0.5467.0(for mac)<span class="line"><!---->110.0.5467.0(for mac)<!----></span><br>110.0.5467.0(for ubuntu)<span class="line"><!---->110.0.5467.0(for ubuntu)<!----></span><br>111.0.5523.0(for ubuntu)<span class="line"><!---->111.0.5523.0(for ubuntu)<!----></span><br><br>repro steps:<span class="line"><!---->repro steps:<!----></span><br>1.  python3 -m http.server 8000 --dir=|path|<span class="line"><!---->1.  python3 -m http.server 8000 --dir=|path|<!----></span><br>2. ./chrome <span class="line"><!---->2. ./chrome <!----></span>http://localhost:8000/crash.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://localhost:8000/crash.html"><!---->http://localhost:8000/crash.html<!----></a> --incognito --user-data-dir=/tmp/x1    --disable-gpu --no-sandbox   --user-data-dir=/tmp/x --use-fake-ui-for-media-stream<span class="line"><!----> --incognito --user-data-dir=/tmp/x1    --disable-gpu --no-sandbox   --user-data-dir=/tmp/x --use-fake-ui-for-media-stream<!----></span><br>Many different crashes will be reproduced in ubuntu every time, I  provided 3 of them in the attachment. <span class="line"><!---->Many different crashes will be reproduced in ubuntu every time, I  provided 3 of them in the attachment. <!----></span><br>Only one kind of crash (Received signal 11 SEGV_MAPERR 375bbd5a1758002) will be reproduced in mac (asan version).<span class="line"><!---->Only one kind of crash (Received signal 11 SEGV_MAPERR 375bbd5a1758002) will be reproduced in mac (asan version).<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>Received signal 11 SEGV_ACCERR 7db000002470<span class="line"><!---->Received signal 11 SEGV_ACCERR 7db000002470<!----></span><br>    #0 0x56105b7169b7 in backtrace [Chrome OS only]: Was the change reviewed and approved by the Eng Prod Representative? <span class="line"><!---->5. If this merge addresses a major issue in the stable channel, does it require manual verification by the test team? If so, please describe required testing.<span class="line"><!---->6.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        Convert issue to new template structure<h3 class="medium-heading">Convert issue to new template structure</h3>
        
          
            Pick a template: <label for="templateInput">Pick a template: </label>
            
              --Please choose a project template--<option value="">--Please choose a project template--</option>
              
                
                   Vpython Wheel Request

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
